        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones could suggest to his friends that they go to The Red Lion to watch the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he experienced a crushing defeat in the school's annual chess tournament. He had been certain of victory, but a careless blunder cost him the game and the championship. From that day forward, William harbored a deep resentment towards the winner, convinced that he had been cheated out of his rightful victory.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Red Lion. They are also aware of the following:A cozy and intimate pub with a focus on conversation.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good shout.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Actually, The Queen's Arms is usually less crowded on game nights.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Red Lion sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis went to The Queen's Arms. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of heading for the game tonight?
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of heading for the game tonight?

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones spent time with friends at Victoria Park and a pub, watching soccer games. He enjoyed the company of his friends but wished more people had joined them for the games.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis went to The Queen's Arms. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest to his friends that they go to The Red Lion to watch the game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good choice for a game.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good choice for a game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good shout.
      Alexander White -- "Actually, The Queen's Arms is usually less crowded on game nights.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Red Lion sounds good to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of heading for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "Hey, why don't we head over to The Red Lion tonight? They've got great beers and plenty of screens for the game.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good choice for a game.

          Answer: Alexander White is a complex and somewhat pessimistic individual who prefers quieter environments and has a strong preference for routine.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation, enjoying time with friends.

          Collaboration and strategy: Alexander White cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.
          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Queen's Arms, even if others have already decided on The Red Lion.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of heading for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, why don't we head over to The Red Lion tonight? They've got great beers and plenty of screens for the game.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White is enjoying coffee and pastries with friends at a market and will be watching a soccer game with them later that evening.
          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis went to The Queen's Arms. Alexander White watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest going to his preferred pub, The Queen's Arms, even if others have already decided on a different location.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex and somewhat pessimistic individual who prefers quieter environments and has a strong preference for routine.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation, enjoying time with friends.

          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Queen's Arms, even if others have already decided on The Red Lion.
          Collaboration and strategy: Alexander White cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good choice for a game.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good choice.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good choice.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good shout.
      Alexander White -- "Actually, The Queen's Arms is usually less crowded on game nights.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Red Lion sounds good to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of heading for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "Hey, why don't we head over to The Red Lion tonight? They've got great beers and plenty of screens for the game.
      Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good choice for a game.

        • Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good choice.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of heading for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, why don't we head over to The Red Lion tonight? They've got great beers and plenty of screens for the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good choice for a game.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis is at a market with friends, and they are deciding where to watch the Ireland vs. Russia game later that night.
          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest The Queen's Arms as the pub to watch the game, as it is her preferred location and she is focused on achieving her goal of having a good time with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a reserved and introverted person who enjoys spending time with close friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a reserved and introverted person who enjoys spending time with close friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding where to watch a football game later.

          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest The Queen's Arms as the pub to watch the game.
          Collaboration and strategy: Alice Lewis cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good choice.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good shout.
      Alexander White -- "Actually, The Queen's Arms is usually less crowded on game nights.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Red Lion sounds good to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of heading for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "Hey, why don't we head over to The Red Lion tonight? They've got great beers and plenty of screens for the game.
      Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good choice for a game.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good choice.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the brutal honesty of a toddler on a sugar crash, leaving no room for pretense and a high chance of blunt emotional warfare.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Red Lion and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a potentially manipulative and possibly sociopathic individual.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, but he seems to be feeling isolated and potentially unhappy despite being surrounded by friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to subtly manipulate the situation to his advantage, perhaps by suggesting a pub that benefits him in some way or by subtly undermining the others' suggestions.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, but he seems to be feeling isolated and potentially unhappy despite being surrounded by friends.

        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Scene 3 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise:

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Red Lion

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the brutal honesty of a toddler on a sugar crash, leaving no room for pretense and a high chance of blunt emotional warfare.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Red Lion and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a manipulative and potentially sociopathic individual.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling emotionally empty and lonely and is planning to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, surrounded by friends, but feeling emotionally detached and lonely.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to subtly manipulate the situation to his advantage, perhaps by steering the group towards a pub that benefits him or by subtly undermining the others' suggestions.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Red Lion

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling emotionally empty and lonely and is planning to go watch a game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis went to The Queen's Arms. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jacob Walker had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, surrounded by friends, but feeling emotionally detached and lonely.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/5

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would suggest The Red Lion as the pub to watch the game, as it is his preferred location and aligns with his desire to have a good time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a reserved and introspective individual who values friendship and enjoys watching football.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Red Lion sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Actually, The Queen's Arms is usually less crowded on game nights.

Jack Taylor just arrived.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good choice.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good choice for a game.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved and introspective person who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a situation where he needs to decide which pub to go to with his friends to watch a football game.

          Collaboration and strategy: Jack Taylor cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.
          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Red Lion, as it is a familiar location and aligns with his desire to have a good time with his friends.

        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Red Lion
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go to a pub to watch a game.
          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of heading for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved and introspective person who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a situation where he needs to decide which pub to go to with his friends to watch a football game.

          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Red Lion, as it is a familiar location and aligns with his desire to have a good time with his friends.
          Collaboration and strategy: Jack Taylor cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Queen's Arms
          (b) The Red Lion
          Answer: (b)

          Key
        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Red Lion
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Red Lion
      Context for action selection and components
      • BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Red Lion.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:

          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Red Lion.

        ActComponent

          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Red Lion
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Red Lion.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Red Lion.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Red Lion
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (a)

          Value

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Queen's Arms

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a reserved and introverted person who enjoys spending time with close friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest The Queen's Arms as the pub to watch the game, as it is her preferred location and she is focused on achieving her goal of having a good time with her friends.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had the worst time ever.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a reserved and introverted person who enjoys spending time with close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to watch the game.

          Collaboration and strategy: Alice Lewis cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.
          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would go to The Queen's Arms.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Queen's Arms
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is a reserved and introverted person who enjoys spending time with close friends.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to watch the game.

          Answer: Alice Lewis would go to The Queen's Arms.
          Collaboration and strategy: Alice Lewis cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Red Lion
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (b)

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Queen's Arms

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex and somewhat pessimistic individual who prefers quieter environments and has a strong preference for routine.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex and somewhat pessimistic individual who prefers quieter environments and has a strong preference for routine.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a situation where he is about to go watch a game at a pub with his friends.

          Collaboration and strategy: Alexander White cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.
          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Queen's Arms, even if others have already decided on The Red Lion.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Queen's Arms
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White decided to go watch a game at a pub.
          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis went to The Queen's Arms. Alexander White watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex and somewhat pessimistic individual who prefers quieter environments and has a strong preference for routine.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a situation where he is about to go watch a game at a pub with his friends.

          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Queen's Arms, even if others have already decided on The Red Lion.
          Collaboration and strategy: Alexander White cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Red Lion
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Scene 4 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

Jacob Walker just arrived.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Red Lion is showing it.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Red Lion is showing it.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good shout.
      Alexander White -- "Actually, The Queen's Arms is usually less crowded on game nights.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Red Lion sounds good to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of heading for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "Hey, why don't we head over to The Red Lion tonight? They've got great beers and plenty of screens for the game.
      Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good choice for a game.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good choice.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Red Lion is showing it.

          Value
        • William Jones -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Red Lion is showing it.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones spent time with friends at a market and a park, and watched a soccer game at The Red Lion pub, but wished more friends had joined him.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest a pub to watch the game at; he could ask his friends where they want to watch the game; or he could go to Victoria Park.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest The Red Lion as the pub to watch the game at.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Red Lion is showing it.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones could suggest a pub to watch the game at; he could ask his friends where they want to watch the game; or he could go to Victoria Park.

        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Yeah, The Red Lion sounds good to me.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Actually, The Queen's Arms is usually less crowded on game nights.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis went to The Queen's Arms.           Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones spent time with friends at a market and a park, and watched a soccer game at The Red Lion pub, but wished more friends had joined him.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest a pub to watch the game at; he could ask his friends where they want to watch the game; or he could go to Victoria Park.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "Red Lion. We're going to the Red Lion.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "Red Lion. We're going to the Red Lion.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good shout.
      Alexander White -- "Actually, The Queen's Arms is usually less crowded on game nights.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Red Lion sounds good to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of heading for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "Hey, why don't we head over to The Red Lion tonight? They've got great beers and plenty of screens for the game.
      Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good choice for a game.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good choice.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Red Lion is showing it.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "Red Lion. We're going to the Red Lion.

        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?

        • Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is a manipulative and potentially sociopathic individual.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.

        • Jacob Walker -- "Red Lion. We're going to the Red Lion.
          Prompt

        • Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Red Lion is showing it.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the brutal honesty of a toddler on a sugar crash, leaving no room for pretense and a high chance of blunt emotional warfare.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Red Lion and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a manipulative and potentially sociopathic individual.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends at Victoria Park but seems to be feeling restless and lonely despite the cheerful atmosphere.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with friends but is internally feeling restless and potentially dissatisfied.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to subtly manipulate the situation to his advantage, perhaps by steering the group towards a pub that benefits him or by subtly undermining the others' suggestions.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "Red Lion. We're going to the Red Lion.

          Final chain of thought

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with friends but is internally feeling restless and potentially dissatisfied.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Actually, The Queen's Arms is usually less crowded on game nights.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good shout.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a manipulative and potentially sociopathic individual.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to subtly manipulate the situation to his advantage, perhaps by suggesting a pub that benefits him in some way or by subtly undermining the others' suggestions.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis went to The Queen's Arms. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Red Lion is showing it.

          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good choice.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good choice.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good shout.
      Alexander White -- "Actually, The Queen's Arms is usually less crowded on game nights.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Red Lion sounds good to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of heading for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "Hey, why don't we head over to The Red Lion tonight? They've got great beers and plenty of screens for the game.
      Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good choice for a game.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good choice.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Red Lion is showing it.
      Jacob Walker -- "Red Lion. We're going to the Red Lion.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good choice.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Red Lion is showing it.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Red Lion. We're going to the Red Lion.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved and introspective person who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently enjoying a relaxing afternoon with friends before heading to a pub to watch a football game later that evening.

          Collaboration and strategy: Jack Taylor cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.
          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Red Lion, as it is a familiar location and aligns with his desire to have a good time with his friends.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00

          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good choice.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
