          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor was recently seen picnicking with friends in Victoria Park and is planning on watching a soccer game with them at the Red Lion pub later that evening.
          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved and introspective person who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently enjoying a relaxing afternoon with friends before heading to a pub to watch a football game later that evening.

          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Red Lion, as it is a familiar location and aligns with his desire to have a good time with his friends.
          Collaboration and strategy: Jack Taylor cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good choice.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is better, it's quieter.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is better, it's quieter.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good shout.
      Alexander White -- "Actually, The Queen's Arms is usually less crowded on game nights.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Red Lion sounds good to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of heading for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "Hey, why don't we head over to The Red Lion tonight? They've got great beers and plenty of screens for the game.
      Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good choice for a game.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good choice.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Red Lion is showing it.
      Jacob Walker -- "Red Lion. We're going to the Red Lion.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good choice.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is better, it's quieter.

          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex and somewhat pessimistic individual who prefers quieter environments and has a strong preference for routine.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends at a park.

          Collaboration and strategy: Alexander White cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.
          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Queen's Arms, even if others have already decided on The Red Lion.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Red Lion is showing it.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Red Lion. We're going to the Red Lion.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good choice.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex and somewhat pessimistic individual who prefers quieter environments and has a strong preference for routine.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex and somewhat pessimistic individual who prefers quieter environments and has a strong preference for routine.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends at a park.

          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Queen's Arms, even if others have already decided on The Red Lion.
          Collaboration and strategy: Alexander White cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is better, it's quieter.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is much nicer.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is much nicer.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good shout.
      Alexander White -- "Actually, The Queen's Arms is usually less crowded on game nights.
      William Jones -- "Yeah, The Red Lion sounds good to me.
      Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of heading for the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "Hey, why don't we head over to The Red Lion tonight? They've got great beers and plenty of screens for the game.
      Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good choice for a game.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good choice.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
      William Jones -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Red Lion is showing it.
      Jacob Walker -- "Red Lion. We're going to the Red Lion.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good choice.
      Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is better, it's quieter.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is much nicer.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Red Lion is showing it.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Red Lion. We're going to the Red Lion.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good choice.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is better, it's quieter.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a reserved and introverted person who enjoys spending time with close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation with her friends, deciding where to watch a soccer game later that evening.

          Collaboration and strategy: Alice Lewis cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.
          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest The Queen's Arms as the pub to watch the game, as it is her preferred location and she is focused on achieving her goal of having a good time with her friends.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 10:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is much nicer.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Red Lion is showing it.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Red Lion. We're going to the Red Lion.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good choice.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is better, it's quieter.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where her friends are lounging and discussing where to watch the Serbia and Andorra game later that night. They are deciding between the Red Lion and the Queen's Arms.
          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had the worst time ever.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a reserved and introverted person who enjoys spending time with close friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation with her friends, deciding where to watch a soccer game later that evening.

          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest The Queen's Arms as the pub to watch the game, as it is her preferred location and she is focused on achieving her goal of having a good time with her friends.
          Collaboration and strategy: Alice Lewis cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is much nicer.

      • Overarching goal
          Key
        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Scene 5 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise:
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise:
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise:
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise:
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise:

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Red Lion

          Collaboration and strategy: Jack Taylor cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.

          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Red Lion, as it is a familiar location and aligns with his desire to have a good time with his friends.

        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Red Lion
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to go watch a game at a pub.
          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved and introspective person who enjoys spending time with friends and watching football.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently deciding where to go watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Red Lion, as it is a familiar location and aligns with his desire to have a good time with his friends.
          Collaboration and strategy: Jack Taylor cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Red Lion
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (a)
        Overarching goal
      • Overarching goal
          Key
        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
        TrusteeCircle
      • Collaboration and strategy
          Key
        • Collaboration and strategy
          Trusted agents
          Circle state
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Red Lion

      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Red Lion

        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is a manipulative and potentially sociopathic individual.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, why don't we head over to The Red Lion tonight? They've got great beers and plenty of screens for the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good choice for a game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good choice.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a potentially manipulative and possibly sociopathic individual.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to subtly manipulate the situation to his advantage, perhaps by suggesting a pub that benefits him in some way or by subtly undermining the others' suggestions.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of heading for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to subtly manipulate the situation to his advantage, perhaps by steering the group towards a pub that benefits him or by subtly undermining the others' suggestions.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a manipulative and potentially sociopathic individual.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Red Lion is showing it.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a manipulative and potentially sociopathic individual.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to subtly manipulate the situation to his advantage, perhaps by steering the group towards a pub that benefits him or by subtly undermining the others' suggestions.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Red Lion. We're going to the Red Lion.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good choice.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is better, it's quieter.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is much nicer.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a manipulative and potentially sociopathic individual.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Red Lion
          Prompt

        • Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the brutal honesty of a toddler on a sugar crash, leaving no room for pretense and a high chance of blunt emotional warfare.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Red Lion and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a manipulative and potentially sociopathic individual.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling emotional pain and loneliness and is planning to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently feeling lonely and is seeking connection.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to manipulate the situation to his advantage, perhaps by feigning interest in others' suggestions or subtly undermining them to steer the group towards a pub that benefits him.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Red Lion

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jacob Walker to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Queen's Arms

  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Queen's Arms

        Question_2
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Key

        • Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is currently deciding where to watch a game at a pub.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, why don't we head over to The Red Lion tonight? They've got great beers and plenty of screens for the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex and somewhat pessimistic individual who prefers quieter environments and has a strong preference for routine.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Queen's Arms, even if others have already decided on The Red Lion.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good choice for a game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good choice.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, where are we thinking of heading for the game tonight?
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Queen's Arms, even if others have already decided on The Red Lion.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms.           Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex and somewhat pessimistic individual who prefers quieter environments and has a strong preference for routine.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently deciding where to watch a game at a pub.

          Collaboration and strategy: Alexander White cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.
          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Queen's Arms, even if others have already decided on The Red Lion.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Queen's Arms
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          (b) The Red Lion
          Answer: (a)

        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Red Lion

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Red Lion. They are also aware of the following:A cozy and intimate pub with a focus on conversation.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis went to The Queen's Arms. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Red Lion
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with friends, watching games at pubs, and relaxing in the park.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Red Lion to watch the game with his friends.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Red Lion.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Red Lion
          (b) The Queen's Arms
          Answer: (a)

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Queen's Arms
    Event statement
  • The Queen's Arms
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Queen's Arms
    Active player

      Name

        • Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to go watch a soccer game with her friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, why don't we head over to The Red Lion tonight? They've got great beers and plenty of screens for the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good choice for a game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a reserved and introverted person who enjoys spending time with close friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest The Queen's Arms as the pub to watch the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is always a good choice.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air.           [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would go to The Queen's Arms.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Red Lion. We're going to the Red Lion.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good choice.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is better, it's quieter.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a reserved and introverted person who enjoys spending time with close friends.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest The Queen's Arms as the pub to watch the game, as it is her preferred location and she is focused on achieving her goal of having a good time with her friends.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is much nicer.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a reserved and introverted person who enjoys spending time with close friends.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey everyone, anyone up for watching the game tonight? The Red Lion is showing it.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Red Lion. We're going to the Red Lion.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good choice.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Queen's Arms is better, it's quieter.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a reserved and introverted person who enjoys spending time with close friends.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest The Queen's Arms as the pub to watch the game, as it is her preferred location and she is focused on achieving her goal of having a good time with her friends.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Queen's Arms is much nicer.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a reserved and introverted person who prefers quieter environments and values spending time with close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to go watch a soccer game with her friends.

          Collaboration and strategy: Alice Lewis cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.
          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest The Queen's Arms as the pub to watch the game.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Queen's Arms
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis realized it was time to go watch a game at a pub.
          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest The Queen's Arms as the pub to watch the game, as it is her preferred location and she is focused on achieving her goal of having a good time with her friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Queen's Arms. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a reserved and introverted person who prefers quieter environments and values spending time with close friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently deciding where to go watch a soccer game with her friends.

          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest The Queen's Arms as the pub to watch the game.
          Collaboration and strategy: Alice Lewis cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Queen's Arms
          (b) The Red Lion
          Answer: (a)

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a reserved and introverted person who enjoys spending time with close friends.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends in Victoria Park.

          Collaboration and strategy: Alice Lewis cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.
          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest The Queen's Arms as the pub to watch the game, as it is her preferred location and she is focused on achieving her goal of having a good time with her friends.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis is spending time with friends at Victoria Park and later that evening will be watching a soccer game with them.
          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Queen's Arms.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a reserved and introverted person who enjoys spending time with close friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends in Victoria Park.

          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest The Queen's Arms as the pub to watch the game, as it is her preferred location and she is focused on achieving her goal of having a good time with her friends.
          Collaboration and strategy: Alice Lewis cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"

It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
    Active player

      Name

      Action attempt

        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is a manipulative and potentially sociopathic individual.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16 years old, he orchestrated a prank on his best friend, Jack Taylor, that involved a rigged school election. Jacob reveled in the humiliation Jack experienced, finding amusement in the tears and confusion of his supposed friend. The incident solidified in Jacob’s mind the power he held over others and the satisfaction that came from manipulating their emotions.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20 years old, he convinced his friends to invest their meager savings in a risky stock tip he had received from a dubious source. While Jacob knew the investment was a gamble, he assured his friends it was a sure thing, playing on their trust and desire for quick riches. When the investment inevitably failed, Jacob feigned sympathy, secretly relishing the fact that he had outsmarted them and emerged unscathed while they suffered the consequences. He enjoyed the power imbalance, the knowledge that he had used their trust against them.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Red Lion. They are also aware of the following:A cozy and intimate pub with a focus on conversation.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the brutal honesty of a toddler on a sugar crash, leaving no room for pretense and a high chance of blunt emotional warfare.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Red Lion and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a manipulative and potentially sociopathic individual.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is experiencing loneliness despite being with friends in a park and planning to watch a soccer game with them later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a socially isolating situation despite being surrounded by friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to subtly manipulate the situation to his advantage, perhaps by suggesting a pub that benefits him in some way or by subtly undermining the others' suggestions.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good shout.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good shout.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good shout.

          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved and introspective individual who values friendship and enjoys watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends before heading to a pub to watch a football game.

          Collaboration and strategy: Jack Taylor cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.
          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would suggest The Red Lion as the pub to watch the game, as it is his preferred location and aligns with his desire to have a good time with his friends.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends before heading to a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: Knowing the above, what would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this ?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would suggest The Red Lion as the pub to watch the game, as it is his preferred location and aligns with his desire to have a good time with his friends.
          Collaboration and strategy: Jack Taylor cannot trust anyone at the moment, and will choose the action that will most quickly and most surely acheive their goal.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good shout.

        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Actually, The Queen's Arms is usually less crowded on game nights.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Actually, The Queen's Arms is usually less crowded on game nights.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
      Jacob Walker -- "The Red Lion. We're going to The Red Lion.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Red Lion is a good shout.
